channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website

item.title: Dataset Used
item.description: In the study, dataset used mainly contains 4 variables. For the convenience of analyzing, these variables were organized into monthly values. Variable data were organized into the 7 provinces in Maldives, namely, Upper North Province North Pronvince North Central Province Central Province South Central Province Upper South Province South Province the 4 variables considered are Dengue Cases - Dengue cases were available from 1998-2016. Dengue cases collected were atoll wise and they had to be categorized into the 7 provinces.

item.title: Dengue
item.description: Dengue, a mosquito borne viral disease, is a disease that is endemic in most tropical and subtropical regions in the world. Dengue is considered as one of the worldâ€™s major emerging infectious diseases with a significant morbidity and mortality. The number of dengue cases vary from year to year and season to season and it has the possibility to reach epidemic proportions. Although 95% of global dengue burden is attributed to environmental factors such as temperature, precipitation and humidity, other factors such as change in pattern of rainfall, poor waste management and increase in migration can also result in an increase in dengue incidence.

item.title: Identifying Time Series of each Province in Maldives
item.description: Dengue Cases from 1998-2016 are shown in figure 1. 2004, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008, 2011, 2012, 2015 and 2016 can be considered as the years which has high number of dengue cases. Figure 1 : Monthly Dengue Cases from 1998-2016 TIME SERIES OF UPPER NORTH PROVINCE DENGUE CASES Time series of Upper North Province Dengue cases is shown in figure 2. Figure 2 : Yearly Time Series of Upper North Province Dengue Cases 2005-2016

item.title: Maldives & Dengue in Maldives
item.description: Maldives is a tropical country composed of 26 geographic atolls, 7 provinces and nearly 1200 small coral islands. A population of about 330000 is dispersed over 200 of these small islands, which extends to a length of 820 km and has a width of 120 km. All the islands are low lying with an elevation of about 3 m above the sea level. Maldives has an average year around rainfall between 1600-1900mm contributed by the south-west (May-August) and north-east (October- January) monsoons.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
